channel.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
channel.description:
Ici's thread now
> # [color=green]Druid[/color] > **[color=green]Neutral Killer[/color]** > > Wall of Nature (Passive) - You are immune to death, poison, and bleeding. > > Root Network (Passive) - The roots will prevent you from visiting someone if it would lead to your death. All players whose rooms have been rooted will investigate as ‘Your targets room is damaged by roots!’ to all investigatives the night they are rooted > > Judgement of the Wild (Day) Publicly mark someone, you will gain a use of Constricting Vines if they aren’t dead by the next day. (Infinite uses, 1 day cooldown) > > Rune of Growth (Day) - Spreading Vines can target two people tonight (Infinite uses, 1 day cooldown) > > Speading Roots (Night) - Curl roots around a player’s room (Infinite uses) > > Constricting Vines (Night) - Kill all people who are vined (0 uses)

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.description:
Well no that isn’t the problem… at least not only. When druid is used like that you have a lack of night kills until suddenly everyone dies. There is no middle ground. If druid dies before, let’s say Day 4, Unseen/cult has to do all the kills.

Read full topic

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
On the subject of ‘wiping out the town in a single strike is unbalanced’ the whole point is that there are many ways to detect the Druid before that happens. A lack of NK kills implies a Druid, so you can figure out they are the NK, and an Observer can detect a Druid because they get the roots AND their normal results.

Read full topic

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Noooooooooooooooo

Your idea anyways, take it away.

I can update the OP

Edit: Actually already did once

Read full topic

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
The funny thing is it would be a good class in ToL.

In FoL NKs need to get kills early on to reduce the opness of town. Games are often solves by D3 or D4 so you really need an NK who can reliably kill before that.

Druid has appeared twice before. The first game it got no kills. The second it got one kill. The concept of a slowburning arsonist class is inherently flawed within FoL

Read full topic

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)

item.description:
Btw this is my idea i’m taking over this thread Night you cannot stop me VIVE LA REVOLOUTION

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
Also the roots only show if you were vined that night. It’s not a ‘lol ur druid’ thing any more.

Read full topic

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
In my version piercing night immunity isn’t a thing. Secondly, it was designed for FoL and not ToL. In FoL one can make informed judgements and vine early. And again, if you do what they want they can’t kill that much.

Read full topic

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.description:
A killer who can kill the entire town with one strike if no one is immune?
Yep.
Who, by this nature, frequently gives no assisting kills whatsoever?
Yep.
A killer who is screwed over by immune people massively?(e.g. Gking and Druid survive, Prince survives, MM and imprisoned Assassin survive…
Yep.
A killer who when piercing Night Immunity and Jail is played like a Time Bomb?
Yep.
Now, how is this a GOOD idea?

Read full topic

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
The problem with that is that it makes Druid investigatible, in a way other NKs aren’t.

If you have roots there is between a 1/2 and 1/3 chance you are the Druid

And if you check twice, you can confirm if they are Druid.

Read full topic

item.title: Druid (Neutral Killer)
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
Ehhh you have a point. Current version:

Druid

Neutral Killer

Wall of Nature (Passive) - You are immune to death, poison, and bleeding.

Root Network (Passive) - The roots will prevent you from visiting someone if it would lead to your death. All players whose rooms have been rooted will investigate as ‘Your targets room is damaged by roots!’ to all investigatives the night they are rooted

Judgement of the Wild (Day) Publicly mark someone, you will gain a use of Constricting Vines if they aren’t dead by the next day. (Infinite uses, 1 day cooldown)

Rune of Growth (Day) - Spreading Vines can target two people tonight (Infinite uses, 1 day cooldown)

Speading Roots (Night) - Curl roots around a player’s room (Infinite uses)

Constricting Vines (Night) - Kill all people who are vined (0 uses)

Read full topic
